title: England captain Harry Kane calls for tougher punishments against racism while Bulgaria could face Euro 2020 expulsion
text:
Harry Kane led calls for tougher punishments against racism as it emerged Uefa could now trigger sanctions to expel Bulgaria from Euro 2020.

The governing body will launch its disciplinary process imminently, with a points and potential tournament disqualification within its remit after the nation failed to clean up its act following a partial stadium closure.

Uefa were taking evidence from three undercover spotters as well as the match officials before announcing a formal investigation later on Tuesday afternoon.

England's players were commended for their tough and dignified response to racism on Monday night, having twice stopped their Euro 2020 qualifying match after a chorus of monkey chants.

Gareth Southgate and captain Kane came close to leading the team off entirely after Tyrone Mings and Raheem Sterling raised the alarm just 22 minutes into the one-sided victory in Sofia.

Kane has since called for "stronger punishments", and questioned whether Uefa's current three-step protocol leading to the ultimate step of abandoning the game is tough enough.
description: Harry Kane led calls for tougher punishments against racism as it emerged Uefa could now trigger sanctions to expel Bulgaria from Euro 2020.
